clauses-english.clause: Alif,
Lam,
Meem.

295.verse-arabic: اللَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ
295.verse-english: Allah - there is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence.

clauses-english.clause: God -
there is no deity except Him,
the Ever-
Living,
the Sustainer of existence.

296.verse-arabic: نَزَّلَ عَلَيْكَ الْكِتَابَ بِالْحَقِّ مُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ وَأَنزَلَ التَّوْرَاةَ وَالْإِنجِيلَ
296.verse-english: He has sent down upon you, [O Muhammad], the Book in truth, confirming what was before it. And He revealed the Torah and the Gospel.

clauses-english.clause: He has sent down upon you,
[O Muhammad],
the Book in truth,
confirming what was before it.
And He revealed the Torah and the Gospel.

297.verse-arabic: مِن قَبْلُ هُدًى لِّلنَّاسِ وَأَنزَلَ الْفُرْقَانَ ۗ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ شَدِيدٌ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَزِيزٌ ذُو انتِقَامٍ
297.verse-english: Before, as guidance for the people. And He revealed the Qur'an. Indeed, those who disbelieve in the verses of Allah will have a severe punishment, and Allah is exalted in Might, the Owner of Retribution.

clauses-english.clause: Before,
as guidance for the people.
And He revealed the Qur'an.
Indeed,
those who disbelieve in the verses of God will have a severe punishment,
and God is exalted in Might,
the Owner of Retribution.

298.verse-arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يَخْفَىٰ عَلَيْهِ شَيْءٌ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِي السَّمَاءِ
298.verse-english: Indeed, from Allah nothing is hidden in the earth nor in the heaven.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
from God nothing is hidden in the earth nor in the heaven.

299.verse-arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي يُصَوِّرُكُمْ فِي الْأَرْحَامِ كَيْفَ يَشَاءُ ۚ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
299.verse-english: It is He who forms you in the wombs however He wills. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

clauses-english.clause: It is He who forms you in the wombs however He wills.
There is no deity except Him,
the Exalted in Might,
the Wise.

300.verse-arabic: هُوَ الَّذِي أَنزَلَ عَلَيْكَ الْكِتَابَ مِنْهُ آيَاتٌ مُّحْكَمَاتٌ هُنَّ أُمُّ الْكِتَابِ وَأُخَرُ مُتَشَابِهَاتٌ ۖ فَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمْ زَيْغٌ فَيَتَّبِعُونَ مَا تَشَابَهَ مِنْهُ ابْتِغَاءَ الْفِتْنَةِ وَابْتِغَاءَ تَأْوِيلِهِ ۗ وَمَا يَعْلَمُ تَأْوِيلَهُ إِلَّا اللَّهُ ۗ وَالرَّاسِخُونَ فِي الْعِلْمِ يَقُولُونَ آمَنَّا بِهِ كُلٌّ مِّنْ عِندِ رَبِّنَا ۗ وَمَا يَذَّكَّرُ إِلَّا أُولُو الْأَلْبَابِ
300.verse-english: It is He who has sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Book; in it are verses [that are] precise - they are the foundation of the Book - and others unspecific. As for those in whose hearts is deviation [from truth], they will follow that of it which is unspecific, seeking discord and seeking an interpretation [suitable to them]. And no one knows its [true] interpretation except Allah. But those firm in knowledge say, "We believe in it. All [of it] is from our Lord." And no one will be reminded except those of understanding.

clauses-english.clause: It is He who has sent down to you,
[O Muhammad],
the Book;
in it are verses [that are] precise -
they are the foundation of the Book -
and others unspecific.
As for those in whose hearts is deviation [from truth],
they will follow that of it which is unspecific,
seeking discord and seeking an interpretation [suitable to them].
And no one knows its [true] interpretation except God.
But those firm in knowledge say,
"We believe in it.
All [of it] is from our Lord.
" And no one will be reminded except those of understanding.

301.verse-arabic: رَبَّنَا لَا تُزِغْ قُلُوبَنَا بَعْدَ إِذْ هَدَيْتَنَا وَهَبْ لَنَا مِن لَّدُنكَ رَحْمَةً ۚ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ الْوَهَّابُ
301.verse-english: [Who say], "Our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy. Indeed, You are the Bestower.

clauses-english.clause: [Who say],
"Our Lord,
let not our hearts deviate after You have guided us and grant us from Yourself mercy.
Indeed,
You are the Bestower.

302.verse-arabic: رَبَّنَا إِنَّكَ جَامِعُ النَّاسِ لِيَوْمٍ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهِ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُخْلِفُ الْمِيعَادَ
302.verse-english: Our Lord, surely You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no doubt. Indeed, Allah does not fail in His promise."

clauses-english.clause: Our Lord,
surely You will gather the people for a Day about which there is no doubt.
Indeed,
God does not fail in His promise.

303.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَن تُغْنِيَ عَنْهُمْ أَمْوَالُهُمْ وَلَا أَوْلَادُهُم مِّنَ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا ۖ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمْ وَقُودُ النَّارِ
303.verse-english: Indeed, those who disbelieve - never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all. And it is they who are fuel for the Fire.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
those who disbelieve -
never will their wealth or their children avail them against God at all.
And it is they who are fuel for the Fire.

304.verse-arabic: كَدَأْبِ آلِ فِرْعَوْنَ وَالَّذِينَ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا فَأَخَذَهُمُ اللَّهُ بِذُنُوبِهِمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ شَدِيدُ الْعِقَابِ
304.verse-english: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them. They denied Our signs, so Allah seized them for their sins. And Allah is severe in penalty.

clauses-english.clause: [Theirs is] like the custom of the people of Pharaoh and those before them.
They denied Our signs,
so God seized them for their sins.
And God is severe in penalty.

305.verse-arabic: قُل لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا سَتُغْلَبُونَ وَتُحْشَرُونَ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ ۚ وَبِئْسَ الْمِهَادُ
305.verse-english: Say to those who disbelieve, "You will be overcome and gathered together to Hell, and wretched is the resting place."

clauses-english.clause: Say to those who disbelieve,
"You will be overcome and gathered together to Hell,
and wretched is the resting place.

306.verse-arabic: قَدْ كَانَ لَكُمْ آيَةٌ فِي فِئَتَيْنِ الْتَقَتَا ۖ فِئَةٌ تُقَاتِلُ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ وَأُخْرَىٰ كَافِرَةٌ يَرَوْنَهُم مِّثْلَيْهِمْ رَأْيَ الْعَيْنِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يُؤَيِّدُ بِنَصْرِهِ مَن يَشَاءُ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِّأُولِي الْأَبْصَارِ
306.verse-english: Already there has been for you a sign in the two armies which met - one fighting in the cause of Allah and another of disbelievers. They saw them [to be] twice their [own] number by [their] eyesight. But Allah supports with His victory whom He wills. Indeed in that is a lesson for those of vision.

clauses-english.clause: Already there has been for you a sign in the two armies which met -
one fighting in the cause of God and another of disbelievers.
They saw them [to be] twice their [own] number by [their] eyesight.
But God supports with His victory whom He wills.
Indeed in that is a lesson for those of vision.

307.verse-arabic: زُيِّنَ لِلنَّاسِ حُبُّ الشَّهَوَاتِ مِنَ النِّسَاءِ وَالْبَنِينَ وَالْقَنَاطِيرِ الْمُقَنطَرَةِ مِنَ الذَّهَبِ وَالْفِضَّةِ وَالْخَيْلِ الْمُسَوَّمَةِ وَالْأَنْعَامِ وَالْحَرْثِ ۗ ذَٰلِكَ مَتَاعُ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا ۖ وَاللَّهُ عِندَهُ حُسْنُ الْمَآبِ
307.verse-english: Beautified for people is the love of that which they desire - of women and sons, heaped-up sums of gold and silver, fine branded horses, and cattle and tilled land. That is the enjoyment of worldly life, but Allah has with Him the best return.

clauses-english.clause: Beautified for people is the love of that which they desire -
of women and sons,
heaped-
up sums of gold and silver,
fine branded horses,
and cattle and tilled land.
That is the enjoyment of worldly life,
but God has with Him the best return.

308.verse-arabic: ۞ قُلْ أَؤُنَبِّئُكُم بِخَيْرٍ مِّن ذَٰلِكُمْ ۚ لِلَّذِينَ اتَّقَوْا عِندَ رَبِّهِمْ جَنَّاتٌ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا وَأَزْوَاجٌ مُّطَهَّرَةٌ وَرِضْوَانٌ مِّنَ اللَّهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ بَصِيرٌ بِالْعِبَادِ
308.verse-english: Say, "Shall I inform you of [something] better than that? For those who fear Allah will be gardens in the presence of their Lord beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally, and purified spouses and approval from Allah. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants -

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"Shall I inform you of [something] better than that?
For those who fear God will be gardens in the presence of their Lord beneath which rivers flow,
wherein they abide eternally,
and purified spouses and approval from God.
And God is Seeing of [His] servants -

309.verse-arabic: الَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا إِنَّنَا آمَنَّا فَاغْفِرْ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَقِنَا عَذَابَ النَّارِ
309.verse-english: Those who say, "Our Lord, indeed we have believed, so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire,"

clauses-english.clause: Those who say,
"Our Lord,
indeed we have believed,
so forgive us our sins and protect us from the punishment of the Fire,

310.verse-arabic: الصَّابِرِينَ وَالصَّادِقِينَ وَالْقَانِتِينَ وَالْمُنفِقِينَ وَالْمُسْتَغْفِرِينَ بِالْأَسْحَارِ
310.verse-english: The patient, the true, the obedient, those who spend [in the way of Allah], and those who seek forgiveness before dawn.

clauses-english.clause: The patient,
the true,
the obedient,
those who spend [in the way of God],
and those who seek forgiveness before dawn.

311.verse-arabic: شَهِدَ اللَّهُ أَنَّهُ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ وَالْمَلَائِكَةُ وَأُولُو الْعِلْمِ قَائِمًا بِالْقِسْطِ ۚ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
311.verse-english: Allah witnesses that there is no deity except Him, and [so do] the angels and those of knowledge - [that He is] maintaining [creation] in justice. There is no deity except Him, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

clauses-english.clause: God witnesses that there is no deity except Him,
and [so do] the angels and those of knowledge -
[that He is] maintaining [creation] in justice.
There is no deity except Him,
the Exalted in Might,
the Wise.

312.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الدِّينَ عِندَ اللَّهِ الْإِسْلَامُ ۗ وَمَا اخْتَلَفَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ إِلَّا مِن بَعْدِ مَا جَاءَهُمُ الْعِلْمُ بَغْيًا بَيْنَهُمْ ۗ وَمَن يَكْفُرْ بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ سَرِيعُ الْحِسَابِ
312.verse-english: Indeed, the religion in the sight of Allah is Islam. And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them - out of jealous animosity between themselves. And whoever disbelieves in the verses of Allah, then indeed, Allah is swift in [taking] account.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
the religion in the sight of God is Islam.
And those who were given the Scripture did not differ except after knowledge had come to them -
out of jealous animosity between themselves.
And whoever disbelieves in the verses of God,
then indeed,
God is swift in [taking] account.

313.verse-arabic: فَإِنْ حَاجُّوكَ فَقُلْ أَسْلَمْتُ وَجْهِيَ لِلَّهِ وَمَنِ اتَّبَعَنِ ۗ وَقُل لِّلَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ وَالْأُمِّيِّينَ أَأَسْلَمْتُمْ ۚ فَإِنْ أَسْلَمُوا فَقَدِ اهْتَدَوا ۖ وَّإِن تَوَلَّوْا فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْكَ الْبَلَاغُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ بَصِيرٌ بِالْعِبَادِ
313.verse-english: So if they argue with you, say, "I have submitted myself to Allah [in Islam], and [so have] those who follow me." And say to those who were given the Scripture and [to] the unlearned, "Have you submitted yourselves?" And if they submit [in Islam], they are rightly guided; but if they turn away - then upon you is only the [duty of] notification. And Allah is Seeing of [His] servants.

clauses-english.clause: So if they argue with you,
say,
"I have submitted myself to God [in Islam],
and [so have] those who follow me.
" And say to those who were given the Scripture and [to] the unlearned,
"Have you submitted yourselves?
" And if they submit [in Islam],
they are rightly guided;
but if they turn away -
then upon you is only the [duty of] notification.
And God is Seeing of [His] servants.

314.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَكْفُرُونَ بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ وَيَقْتُلُونَ النَّبِيِّينَ بِغَيْرِ حَقٍّ وَيَقْتُلُونَ الَّذِينَ يَأْمُرُونَ بِالْقِسْطِ مِنَ النَّاسِ فَبَشِّرْهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ
314.verse-english: Those who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and kill the prophets without right and kill those who order justice from among the people - give them tidings of a painful punishment.

clauses-english.clause: Those who disbelieve in the signs of God and kill the prophets without right and kill those who order justice from among the people -
give them tidings of a painful punishment.

315.verse-arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ حَبِطَتْ أَعْمَالُهُمْ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن نَّاصِرِينَ
315.verse-english: They are the ones whose deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter, and for them there will be no helpers.

clauses-english.clause: They are the ones whose deeds have become worthless in this world and the Hereafter,
and for them there will be no helpers.

316.verse-arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَى الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا نَصِيبًا مِّنَ الْكِتَابِ يُدْعَوْنَ إِلَىٰ كِتَابِ اللَّهِ لِيَحْكُمَ بَيْنَهُمْ ثُمَّ يَتَوَلَّىٰ فَرِيقٌ مِّنْهُمْ وَهُم مُّعْرِضُونَ
316.verse-english: Do you not consider, [O Muhammad], those who were given a portion of the Scripture? They are invited to the Scripture of Allah that it should arbitrate between them; then a party of them turns away, and they are refusing.

clauses-english.clause: Do you not consider,
[O Muhammad],
those who were given a portion of the Scripture?
They are invited to the Scripture of God that it should arbitrate between them;
then a party of them turns away,
and they are refusing.

317.verse-arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَالُوا لَن تَمَسَّنَا النَّارُ إِلَّا أَيَّامًا مَّعْدُودَاتٍ ۖ وَغَرَّهُمْ فِي دِينِهِم مَّا كَانُوا يَفْتَرُونَ
317.verse-english: That is because they say, "Never will the Fire touch us except for [a few] numbered days," and [because] they were deluded in their religion by what they were inventing.

clauses-english.clause: That is because they say,
"Never will the Fire touch us except for [a few] numbered days,
" and [because] they were deluded in their religion by what they were inventing.

318.verse-arabic: فَكَيْفَ إِذَا جَمَعْنَاهُمْ لِيَوْمٍ لَّا رَيْبَ فِيهِ وَوُفِّيَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّا كَسَبَتْ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ
318.verse-english: So how will it be when We assemble them for a Day about which there is no doubt? And each soul will be compensated [in full for] what it earned, and they will not be wronged.

clauses-english.clause: So how will it be when We assemble them for a Day about which there is no doubt?
And each soul will be compensated [in full for] what it earned,
and they will not be wronged.

319.verse-arabic: قُلِ اللَّهُمَّ مَالِكَ الْمُلْكِ تُؤْتِي الْمُلْكَ مَن تَشَاءُ وَتَنزِعُ الْمُلْكَ مِمَّن تَشَاءُ وَتُعِزُّ مَن تَشَاءُ وَتُذِلُّ مَن تَشَاءُ ۖ بِيَدِكَ الْخَيْرُ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
319.verse-english: Say, "O Allah, Owner of Sovereignty, You give sovereignty to whom You will and You take sovereignty away from whom You will. You honor whom You will and You humble whom You will. In Your hand is [all] good. Indeed, You are over all things competent.

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"O God,
Owner of Sovereignty,
You give sovereignty to whom You will and You take sovereignty away from whom You will.
You honor whom You will and You humble whom You will.
In Your hand is [all] good.
Indeed,
You are over all things competent.

320.verse-arabic: تُولِجُ اللَّيْلَ فِي النَّهَارِ وَتُولِجُ النَّهَارَ فِي اللَّيْلِ ۖ وَتُخْرِجُ الْحَيَّ مِنَ الْمَيِّتِ وَتُخْرِجُ الْمَيِّتَ مِنَ الْحَيِّ ۖ وَتَرْزُقُ مَن تَشَاءُ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
320.verse-english: You cause the night to enter the day, and You cause the day to enter the night; and You bring the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living. And You give provision to whom You will without account."

clauses-english.clause: You cause the night to enter the day,
and You cause the day to enter the night;
and You bring the living out of the dead,
and You bring the dead out of the living.
And You give provision to whom You will without account.

321.verse-arabic: لَّا يَتَّخِذِ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ الْكَافِرِينَ أَوْلِيَاءَ مِن دُونِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ۖ وَمَن يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ فَلَيْسَ مِنَ اللَّهِ فِي شَيْءٍ إِلَّا أَن تَتَّقُوا مِنْهُمْ تُقَاةً ۗ وَيُحَذِّرُكُمُ اللَّهُ نَفْسَهُ ۗ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ الْمَصِيرُ
321.verse-english: Let not believers take disbelievers as allies rather than believers. And whoever [of you] does that has nothing with Allah, except when taking precaution against them in prudence. And Allah warns you of Himself, and to Allah is the [final] destination.

clauses-english.clause: Let not believers take disbelievers as allies rather than believers.
And whoever [of you] does that has nothing with God,
except when taking precaution against them in prudence.
And God warns you of Himself,
and to God is the [final] destination.

322.verse-arabic: قُلْ إِن تُخْفُوا مَا فِي صُدُورِكُمْ أَوْ تُبْدُوهُ يَعْلَمْهُ اللَّهُ ۗ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
322.verse-english: Say, "Whether you conceal what is in your breasts or reveal it, Allah knows it. And He knows that which is in the heavens and that which is on the earth. And Allah is over all things competent.

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"Whether you conceal what is in your breasts or reveal it,
God knows it.
And He knows that which is in the heavens and that which is on the earth.
And God is over all things competent.

323.verse-arabic: يَوْمَ تَجِدُ كُلُّ نَفْسٍ مَّا عَمِلَتْ مِنْ خَيْرٍ مُّحْضَرًا وَمَا عَمِلَتْ مِن سُوءٍ تَوَدُّ لَوْ أَنَّ بَيْنَهَا وَبَيْنَهُ أَمَدًا بَعِيدًا ۗ وَيُحَذِّرُكُمُ اللَّهُ نَفْسَهُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ رَءُوفٌ بِالْعِبَادِ
323.verse-english: The Day every soul will find what it has done of good present [before it] and what it has done of evil, it will wish that between itself and that [evil] was a great distance. And Allah warns you of Himself, and Allah is Kind to [His] servants."

clauses-english.clause: The Day every soul will find what it has done of good present [before it] and what it has done of evil,
it will wish that between itself and that [evil] was a great distance.
And God warns you of Himself,
and God is Kind to [His] servants.

324.verse-arabic: قُلْ إِن كُنتُمْ تُحِبُّونَ اللَّهَ فَاتَّبِعُونِي يُحْبِبْكُمُ اللَّهُ وَيَغْفِرْ لَكُمْ ذُنُوبَكُمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
324.verse-english: Say, [O Muhammad], "If you should love Allah, then follow me, [so] Allah will love you and forgive you your sins. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful."

clauses-english.clause: Say,
[O Muhammad],
"If you should love God,
then follow me,
[so] God will love you and forgive you your sins.
And God is Forgiving and Merciful.

325.verse-arabic: قُلْ أَطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَالرَّسُولَ ۖ فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ الْكَافِرِينَ
325.verse-english: Say, "Obey Allah and the Messenger." But if they turn away - then indeed, Allah does not like the disbelievers.

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"Obey God and the Messenger.
" But if they turn away -
then indeed,
God does not like the disbelievers.

326.verse-arabic: ۞ إِنَّ اللَّهَ اصْطَفَىٰ آدَمَ وَنُوحًا وَآلَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَآلَ عِمْرَانَ عَلَى الْعَالَمِينَ
326.verse-english: Indeed, Allah chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of 'Imran over the worlds -

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
God chose Adam and Noah and the family of Abraham and the family of 'Imran over the worlds -

327.verse-arabic: ذُرِّيَّةً بَعْضُهَا مِن بَعْضٍ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
327.verse-english: Descendants, some of them from others. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

clauses-english.clause: Descendants,
some of them from others.
And God is Hearing and Knowing.

328.verse-arabic: إِذْ قَالَتِ امْرَأَتُ عِمْرَانَ رَبِّ إِنِّي نَذَرْتُ لَكَ مَا فِي بَطْنِي مُحَرَّرًا فَتَقَبَّلْ مِنِّي ۖ إِنَّكَ أَنتَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
328.verse-english: [Mention, O Muhammad], when the wife of 'Imran said, "My Lord, indeed I have pledged to You what is in my womb, consecrated [for Your service], so accept this from me. Indeed, You are the Hearing, the Knowing."

clauses-english.clause: [Mention,
O Muhammad],
when the wife of 'Imran said,
"My Lord,
indeed I have pledged to You what is in my womb,
consecrated [for Your service],
so accept this from me.
Indeed,
You are the Hearing,
the Knowing.

329.verse-arabic: فَلَمَّا وَضَعَتْهَا قَالَتْ رَبِّ إِنِّي وَضَعْتُهَا أُنثَىٰ وَاللَّهُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا وَضَعَتْ وَلَيْسَ الذَّكَرُ كَالْأُنثَىٰ ۖ وَإِنِّي سَمَّيْتُهَا مَرْيَمَ وَإِنِّي أُعِيذُهَا بِكَ وَذُرِّيَّتَهَا مِنَ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ
329.verse-english: But when she delivered her, she said, "My Lord, I have delivered a female." And Allah was most knowing of what she delivered, "And the male is not like the female. And I have named her Mary, and I seek refuge for her in You and [for] her descendants from Satan, the expelled [from the mercy of Allah]."

clauses-english.clause: But when she delivered her,
she said,
"My Lord,
I have delivered a female.
" And God was most knowing of what she delivered,
"And the male is not like the female.
And I have named her Mary,
and I seek refuge for her in You and [for] her descendants from Satan,
the expelled [from the mercy of God].

330.verse-arabic: فَتَقَبَّلَهَا رَبُّهَا بِقَبُولٍ حَسَنٍ وَأَنبَتَهَا نَبَاتًا حَسَنًا وَكَفَّلَهَا زَكَرِيَّا ۖ كُلَّمَا دَخَلَ عَلَيْهَا زَكَرِيَّا الْمِحْرَابَ وَجَدَ عِندَهَا رِزْقًا ۖ قَالَ يَا مَرْيَمُ أَنَّىٰ لَكِ هَٰذَا ۖ قَالَتْ هُوَ مِنْ عِندِ اللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يَرْزُقُ مَن يَشَاءُ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
330.verse-english: So her Lord accepted her with good acceptance and caused her to grow in a good manner and put her in the care of Zechariah. Every time Zechariah entered upon her in the prayer chamber, he found with her provision. He said, "O Mary, from where is this [coming] to you?" She said, "It is from Allah. Indeed, Allah provides for whom He wills without account."

clauses-english.clause: So her Lord accepted her with good acceptance and caused her to grow in a good manner and put her in the care of Zechariah.
Every time Zechariah entered upon her in the prayer chamber,
he found with her provision.
He said,
"O Mary,
from where is this [coming] to you?
" She said,
"It is from God.
Indeed,
God provides for whom He wills without account.

331.verse-arabic: هُنَالِكَ دَعَا زَكَرِيَّا رَبَّهُ ۖ قَالَ رَبِّ هَبْ لِي مِن لَّدُنكَ ذُرِّيَّةً طَيِّبَةً ۖ إِنَّكَ سَمِيعُ الدُّعَاءِ
331.verse-english: At that, Zechariah called upon his Lord, saying, "My Lord, grant me from Yourself a good offspring. Indeed, You are the Hearer of supplication."

clauses-english.clause: At that,
Zechariah called upon his Lord,
saying,
"My Lord,
grant me from Yourself a good offspring.
Indeed,
You are the Hearer of supplication.

332.verse-arabic: فَنَادَتْهُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَهُوَ قَائِمٌ يُصَلِّي فِي الْمِحْرَابِ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُبَشِّرُكَ بِيَحْيَىٰ مُصَدِّقًا بِكَلِمَةٍ مِّنَ اللَّهِ وَسَيِّدًا وَحَصُورًا وَنَبِيًّا مِّنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
332.verse-english: So the angels called him while he was standing in prayer in the chamber, "Indeed, Allah gives you good tidings of John, confirming a word from Allah and [who will be] honorable, abstaining [from women], and a prophet from among the righteous."

clauses-english.clause: So the angels called him while he was standing in prayer in the chamber,
"Indeed,
God gives you good tidings of John,
confirming a word from God and [who will be] honorable,
abstaining [from women],
and a prophet from among the righteous.

333.verse-arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِي غُلَامٌ وَقَدْ بَلَغَنِيَ الْكِبَرُ وَامْرَأَتِي عَاقِرٌ ۖ قَالَ كَذَٰلِكَ اللَّهُ يَفْعَلُ مَا يَشَاءُ
333.verse-english: He said, "My Lord, how will I have a boy when I have reached old age and my wife is barren?" The angel said, "Such is Allah; He does what He wills."

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"My Lord,
how will I have a boy when I have reached old age and my wife is barren?
" The angel said,
"Such is God;
He does what He wills.

334.verse-arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ اجْعَل لِّي آيَةً ۖ قَالَ آيَتُكَ أَلَّا تُكَلِّمَ النَّاسَ ثَلَاثَةَ أَيَّامٍ إِلَّا رَمْزًا ۗ وَاذْكُر رَّبَّكَ كَثِيرًا وَسَبِّحْ بِالْعَشِيِّ وَالْإِبْكَارِ
334.verse-english: He said, "My Lord, make for me a sign." He Said, "Your sign is that you will not [be able to] speak to the people for three days except by gesture. And remember your Lord much and exalt [Him with praise] in the evening and the morning."

clauses-english.clause: He said,
"My Lord,
make for me a sign.
" He Said,
"Your sign is that you will not [be able to] speak to the people for three days except by gesture.
And remember your Lord much and exalt [Him with praise] in the evening and the morning.

335.verse-arabic: وَإِذْ قَالَتِ الْمَلَائِكَةُ يَا مَرْيَمُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ اصْطَفَاكِ وَطَهَّرَكِ وَاصْطَفَاكِ عَلَىٰ نِسَاءِ الْعَالَمِينَ
335.verse-english: And [mention] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed Allah has chosen you and purified you and chosen you above the women of the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: And [mention] when the angels said,
"O Mary,
indeed God has chosen you and purified you and chosen you above the women of the worlds.

336.verse-arabic: يَا مَرْيَمُ اقْنُتِي لِرَبِّكِ وَاسْجُدِي وَارْكَعِي مَعَ الرَّاكِعِينَ
336.verse-english: O Mary, be devoutly obedient to your Lord and prostrate and bow with those who bow [in prayer]."

clauses-english.clause: O Mary,
be devoutly obedient to your Lord and prostrate and bow with those who bow [in prayer].

337.verse-arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ أَنبَاءِ الْغَيْبِ نُوحِيهِ إِلَيْكَ ۚ وَمَا كُنتَ لَدَيْهِمْ إِذْ يُلْقُونَ أَقْلَامَهُمْ أَيُّهُمْ يَكْفُلُ مَرْيَمَ وَمَا كُنتَ لَدَيْهِمْ إِذْ يَخْتَصِمُونَ
337.verse-english: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. And you were not with them when they cast their pens as to which of them should be responsible for Mary. Nor were you with them when they disputed.

clauses-english.clause: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you,
[O Muhammad].
And you were not with them when they cast their pens as to which of them should be responsible for Mary.
Nor were you with them when they disputed.

338.verse-arabic: إِذْ قَالَتِ الْمَلَائِكَةُ يَا مَرْيَمُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ يُبَشِّرُكِ بِكَلِمَةٍ مِّنْهُ اسْمُهُ الْمَسِيحُ عِيسَى ابْنُ مَرْيَمَ وَجِيهًا فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ وَمِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ
338.verse-english: [And mention] when the angels said, "O Mary, indeed Allah gives you good tidings of a word from Him, whose name will be the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary - distinguished in this world and the Hereafter and among those brought near [to Allah].

clauses-english.clause: [And mention] when the angels said,
"O Mary,
indeed God gives you good tidings of a word from Him,
whose name will be the Messiah,
Jesus,
the son of Mary -
distinguished in this world and the Hereafter and among those brought near [to God].

339.verse-arabic: وَيُكَلِّمُ النَّاسَ فِي الْمَهْدِ وَكَهْلًا وَمِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
339.verse-english: He will speak to the people in the cradle and in maturity and will be of the righteous."

clauses-english.clause: He will speak to the people in the cradle and in maturity and will be of the righteous.

340.verse-arabic: قَالَتْ رَبِّ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لِي وَلَدٌ وَلَمْ يَمْسَسْنِي بَشَرٌ ۖ قَالَ كَذَٰلِكِ اللَّهُ يَخْلُقُ مَا يَشَاءُ ۚ إِذَا قَضَىٰ أَمْرًا فَإِنَّمَا يَقُولُ لَهُ كُن فَيَكُونُ
340.verse-english: She said, "My Lord, how will I have a child when no man has touched me?" [The angel] said, "Such is Allah; He creates what He wills. When He decrees a matter, He only says to it, 'Be,' and it is.

clauses-english.clause: She said,
"My Lord,
how will I have a child when no man has touched me?
" [The angel] said,
"Such is God;
He creates what He wills.
When He decrees a matter,
He only says to it,
'Be,
' and it is.

341.verse-english: And He will teach him writing and wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel

clauses-english.clause: And He will teach him writing and wisdom and the Torah and the Gospel

342.verse-arabic: وَرَسُولًا إِلَىٰ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ أَنِّي قَدْ جِئْتُكُم بِآيَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ أَنِّي أَخْلُقُ لَكُم مِّنَ الطِّينِ كَهَيْئَةِ الطَّيْرِ فَأَنفُخُ فِيهِ فَيَكُونُ طَيْرًا بِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ ۖ وَأُبْرِئُ الْأَكْمَهَ وَالْأَبْرَصَ وَأُحْيِي الْمَوْتَىٰ بِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ ۖ وَأُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا تَأْكُلُونَ وَمَا تَدَّخِرُونَ فِي بُيُوتِكُمْ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
342.verse-english: And [make him] a messenger to the Children of Israel, [who will say], 'Indeed I have come to you with a sign from your Lord in that I design for you from clay [that which is] like the form of a bird, then I breathe into it and it becomes a bird by permission of Allah. And I cure the blind and the leper, and I give life to the dead - by permission of Allah. And I inform you of what you eat and what you store in your houses. Indeed in that is a sign for you, if you are believers.

clauses-english.clause: And [make him] a messenger to the Children of Israel,
[who will say],
'Indeed I have come to you with a sign from your Lord in that I design for you from clay [that which is] like the form of a bird,
then I breathe into it and it becomes a bird by permission of God.
And I cure the blind and the leper,
and I give life to the dead -
by permission of God.
And I inform you of what you eat and what you store in your houses.
Indeed in that is a sign for you,
if you are believers.

343.verse-arabic: وَمُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيَّ مِنَ التَّوْرَاةِ وَلِأُحِلَّ لَكُم بَعْضَ الَّذِي حُرِّمَ عَلَيْكُمْ ۚ وَجِئْتُكُم بِآيَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
343.verse-english: And [I have come] confirming what was before me of the Torah and to make lawful for you some of what was forbidden to you. And I have come to you with a sign from your Lord, so fear Allah and obey me.

clauses-english.clause: And [I have come] confirming what was before me of the Torah and to make lawful for you some of what was forbidden to you.
And I have come to you with a sign from your Lord,
so fear God and obey me.

344.verse-arabic: إِنَّ اللَّهَ رَبِّي وَرَبُّكُمْ فَاعْبُدُوهُ ۗ هَٰذَا صِرَاطٌ مُّسْتَقِيمٌ
344.verse-english: Indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. That is the straight path."

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
God is my Lord and your Lord,
so worship Him.
That is the straight path.

345.verse-arabic: ۞ فَلَمَّا أَحَسَّ عِيسَىٰ مِنْهُمُ الْكُفْرَ قَالَ مَنْ أَنصَارِي إِلَى اللَّهِ ۖ قَالَ الْحَوَارِيُّونَ نَحْنُ أَنصَارُ اللَّهِ آمَنَّا بِاللَّهِ وَاشْهَدْ بِأَنَّا مُسْلِمُونَ
345.verse-english: But when Jesus felt [persistence in] disbelief from them, he said, "Who are my supporters for [the cause of] Allah?" The disciples said, "We are supporters for Allah. We have believed in Allah and testify that we are Muslims [submitting to Him].

clauses-english.clause: But when Jesus felt [persistence in] disbelief from them,
he said,
"Who are my supporters for [the cause of] God?
" The disciples said,
"We are supporters for God.
We have believed in God and testify that we are Muslims [submitting to Him].

346.verse-arabic: رَبَّنَا آمَنَّا بِمَا أَنزَلْتَ وَاتَّبَعْنَا الرَّسُولَ فَاكْتُبْنَا مَعَ الشَّاهِدِينَ
346.verse-english: Our Lord, we have believed in what You revealed and have followed the messenger Jesus, so register us among the witnesses [to truth]."

clauses-english.clause: Our Lord,
we have believed in what You revealed and have followed the messenger Jesus,
so register us among the witnesses [to truth].

347.verse-arabic: وَمَكَرُوا وَمَكَرَ اللَّهُ ۖ وَاللَّهُ خَيْرُ الْمَاكِرِينَ
347.verse-english: And the disbelievers planned, but Allah planned. And Allah is the best of planners.

clauses-english.clause: And the disbelievers planned,
but God planned.
And God is the best of planners.

348.verse-arabic: إِذْ قَالَ اللَّهُ يَا عِيسَىٰ إِنِّي مُتَوَفِّيكَ وَرَافِعُكَ إِلَيَّ وَمُطَهِّرُكَ مِنَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَجَاعِلُ الَّذِينَ اتَّبَعُوكَ فَوْقَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ الْقِيَامَةِ ۖ ثُمَّ إِلَيَّ مَرْجِعُكُمْ فَأَحْكُمُ بَيْنَكُمْ فِيمَا كُنتُمْ فِيهِ تَخْتَلِفُونَ
348.verse-english: [Mention] when Allah said, "O Jesus, indeed I will take you and raise you to Myself and purify you from those who disbelieve and make those who follow you [in submission to Allah alone] superior to those who disbelieve until the Day of Resurrection. Then to Me is your return, and I will judge between you concerning that in which you used to differ.

clauses-english.clause: [Mention] when God said,
"O Jesus,

indeed I will take you and raise you to Myself and purify you from those who disbelieve and make those who follow you [in submission to God alone] superior to those who disbelieve until the Day of Resurrection.
Then to Me is your return,
and I will judge between you concerning that in which you used to differ.

349.verse-arabic: فَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا فَأُعَذِّبُهُمْ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن نَّاصِرِينَ
349.verse-english: And as for those who disbelieved, I will punish them with a severe punishment in this world and the Hereafter, and they will have no helpers."

clauses-english.clause: And as for those who disbelieved,
I will punish them with a severe punishment in this world and the Hereafter,
and they will have no helpers.

350.verse-arabic: وَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ فَيُوَفِّيهِمْ أُجُورَهُمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ الظَّالِمِينَ
350.verse-english: But as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, He will give them in full their rewards, and Allah does not like the wrongdoers.

clauses-english.clause: But as for those who believed and did righteous deeds,
He will give them in full their rewards,
and God does not like the wrongdoers.

351.verse-arabic: ذَٰلِكَ نَتْلُوهُ عَلَيْكَ مِنَ الْآيَاتِ وَالذِّكْرِ الْحَكِيمِ
351.verse-english: This is what We recite to you, [O Muhammad], of [Our] verses and the precise [and wise] message.

clauses-english.clause: This is what We recite to you,
[O Muhammad],
of [Our] verses and the precise [and wise] message.

352.verse-arabic: إِنَّ مَثَلَ عِيسَىٰ عِندَ اللَّهِ كَمَثَلِ آدَمَ ۖ خَلَقَهُ مِن تُرَابٍ ثُمَّ قَالَ لَهُ كُن فَيَكُونُ
352.verse-english: Indeed, the example of Jesus to Allah is like that of Adam. He created Him from dust; then He said to him, "Be," and he was.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
the example of Jesus to God is like that of Adam.
He created Him from dust;
then He said to him,
"Be,
" and he was.

353.verse-arabic: الْحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكَ فَلَا تَكُن مِّنَ الْمُمْتَرِينَ
353.verse-english: The truth is from your Lord, so do not be among the doubters.

clauses-english.clause: The truth is from your Lord,
so do not be among the doubters.

354.verse-arabic: فَمَنْ حَاجَّكَ فِيهِ مِن بَعْدِ مَا جَاءَكَ مِنَ الْعِلْمِ فَقُلْ تَعَالَوْا نَدْعُ أَبْنَاءَنَا وَأَبْنَاءَكُمْ وَنِسَاءَنَا وَنِسَاءَكُمْ وَأَنفُسَنَا وَأَنفُسَكُمْ ثُمَّ نَبْتَهِلْ فَنَجْعَل لَّعْنَتَ اللَّهِ عَلَى الْكَاذِبِينَ
354.verse-english: Then whoever argues with you about it after [this] knowledge has come to you - say, "Come, let us call our sons and your sons, our women and your women, ourselves and yourselves, then supplicate earnestly [together] and invoke the curse of Allah upon the liars [among us]."

clauses-english.clause: Then whoever argues with you about it after [this] knowledge has come to you -
say,
"Come,
let us call our sons and your sons,
our women and your women,
ourselves and yourselves,
then supplicate earnestly [together] and invoke the curse of God upon the liars [among us].

355.verse-arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ الْقَصَصُ الْحَقُّ ۚ وَمَا مِنْ إِلَٰهٍ إِلَّا اللَّهُ ۚ وَإِنَّ اللَّهَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الْحَكِيمُ
355.verse-english: Indeed, this is the true narration. And there is no deity except Allah. And indeed, Allah is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
this is the true narration.
And there is no deity except God.
And indeed,
God is the Exalted in Might,
the Wise.

356.verse-arabic: فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ بِالْمُفْسِدِينَ
356.verse-english: But if they turn away, then indeed - Allah is Knowing of the corrupters.

clauses-english.clause: But if they turn away,
then indeed -
God is Knowing of the corrupters.

357.verse-arabic: قُلْ يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ تَعَالَوْا إِلَىٰ كَلِمَةٍ سَوَاءٍ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَكُمْ أَلَّا نَعْبُدَ إِلَّا اللَّهَ وَلَا نُشْرِكَ بِهِ شَيْئًا وَلَا يَتَّخِذَ بَعْضُنَا بَعْضًا أَرْبَابًا مِّن دُونِ اللَّهِ ۚ فَإِن تَوَلَّوْا فَقُولُوا اشْهَدُوا بِأَنَّا مُسْلِمُونَ
357.verse-english: Say, "O People of the Scripture, come to a word that is equitable between us and you - that we will not worship except Allah and not associate anything with Him and not take one another as lords instead of Allah." But if they turn away, then say, "Bear witness that we are Muslims [submitting to Him]."

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"O People of the Scripture,
come to a word that is equitable between us and you -
that we will not worship except God and not associate anything with Him and not take one another as lords instead of God.
" But if they turn away,
then say,
"Bear witness that we are Muslims [submitting to Him].

358.verse-arabic: يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ لِمَ تُحَاجُّونَ فِي إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَمَا أُنزِلَتِ التَّوْرَاةُ وَالْإِنجِيلُ إِلَّا مِن بَعْدِهِ ۚ أَفَلَا تَعْقِلُونَ
358.verse-english: O People of the Scripture, why do you argue about Abraham while the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed until after him? Then will you not reason?

clauses-english.clause: O People of the Scripture,
why do you argue about Abraham while the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed until after him?
Then will you not reason?

359.verse-arabic: هَا أَنتُمْ هَٰؤُلَاءِ حَاجَجْتُمْ فِيمَا لَكُم بِهِ عِلْمٌ فَلِمَ تُحَاجُّونَ فِيمَا لَيْسَ لَكُم بِهِ عِلْمٌ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ وَأَنتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
359.verse-english: Here you are - those who have argued about that of which you have [some] knowledge, but why do you argue about that of which you have no knowledge? And Allah knows, while you know not.

clauses-english.clause: Here you are -
those who have argued about that of which you have [some] knowledge,
but why do you argue about that of which you have no knowledge?
And God knows,
while you know not.

360.verse-arabic: مَا كَانَ إِبْرَاهِيمُ يَهُودِيًّا وَلَا نَصْرَانِيًّا وَلَٰكِن كَانَ حَنِيفًا مُّسْلِمًا وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
360.verse-english: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian, but he was one inclining toward truth, a Muslim [submitting to Allah]. And he was not of the polytheists.

clauses-english.clause: Abraham was neither a Jew nor a Christian,
but he was one inclining toward truth,
a Muslim [submitting to God].
And he was not of the polytheists.

361.verse-arabic: إِنَّ أَوْلَى النَّاسِ بِإِبْرَاهِيمَ لَلَّذِينَ اتَّبَعُوهُ وَهَٰذَا النَّبِيُّ وَالَّذِينَ آمَنُوا ۗ وَاللَّهُ وَلِيُّ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
361.verse-english: Indeed, the most worthy of Abraham among the people are those who followed him [in submission to Allah] and this prophet, and those who believe [in his message]. And Allah is the ally of the believers.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
the most worthy of Abraham among the people are those who followed him [in submission to God] and this prophet,
and those who believe [in his message].
And God is the ally of the believers.

362.verse-arabic: وَدَّت طَّائِفَةٌ مِّنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ لَوْ يُضِلُّونَكُمْ وَمَا يُضِلُّونَ إِلَّا أَنفُسَهُمْ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ
362.verse-english: A faction of the people of the Scripture wish they could mislead you. But they do not mislead except themselves, and they perceive [it] not.

clauses-english.clause: A faction of the people of the Scripture wish they could mislead you.
But they do not mislead except themselves,
and they perceive [it] not.

363.verse-arabic: يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ لِمَ تَكْفُرُونَ بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ وَأَنتُمْ تَشْهَدُونَ
363.verse-english: O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allah while you witness [to their truth]?

clauses-english.clause: O People of the Scripture,
why do you disbelieve in the verses of God while you witness [to their truth]?

364.verse-arabic: يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ لِمَ تَلْبِسُونَ الْحَقَّ بِالْبَاطِلِ وَتَكْتُمُونَ الْحَقَّ وَأَنتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
364.verse-english: O People of the Scripture, why do you confuse the truth with falsehood and conceal the truth while you know [it]?

clauses-english.clause: O People of the Scripture,
why do you confuse the truth with falsehood and conceal the truth while you know [it]?

365.verse-arabic: وَقَالَت طَّائِفَةٌ مِّنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ آمِنُوا بِالَّذِي أُنزِلَ عَلَى الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَجْهَ النَّهَارِ وَاكْفُرُوا آخِرَهُ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَرْجِعُونَ
365.verse-english: And a faction of the People of the Scripture say [to each other], "Believe in that which was revealed to the believers at the beginning of the day and reject it at its end that perhaps they will abandon their religion,

clauses-english.clause: And a faction of the People of the Scripture say [to each other],
"Believe in that which was revealed to the believers at the beginning of the day and reject it at its end that perhaps they will abandon their religion,

366.verse-arabic: وَلَا تُؤْمِنُوا إِلَّا لِمَن تَبِعَ دِينَكُمْ قُلْ إِنَّ الْهُدَىٰ هُدَى اللَّهِ أَن يُؤْتَىٰ أَحَدٌ مِّثْلَ مَا أُوتِيتُمْ أَوْ يُحَاجُّوكُمْ عِندَ رَبِّكُمْ ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ الْفَضْلَ بِيَدِ اللَّهِ يُؤْتِيهِ مَن يَشَاءُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ وَاسِعٌ عَلِيمٌ
366.verse-english: And do not trust except those who follow your religion." Say, "Indeed, the [true] guidance is the guidance of Allah. [Do you fear] lest someone be given [knowledge] like you were given or that they would [thereby] argue with you before your Lord?" Say, "Indeed, [all] bounty is in the hand of Allah - He grants it to whom He wills. And Allah is all-Encompassing and Wise."

clauses-english.clause: And do not trust except those who follow your religion.
" Say,
"Indeed,
the [true] guidance is the guidance of God.
[Do you fear] lest someone be given [knowledge] like you were given or that they would [thereby] argue with you before your Lord?
" Say,
"Indeed,
[all] bounty is in the hand of God -
He grants it to whom He wills.
And God is all-
Encompassing and Wise.

367.verse-arabic: يَخْتَصُّ بِرَحْمَتِهِ مَن يَشَاءُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ ذُو الْفَضْلِ الْعَظِيمِ
367.verse-english: He selects for His mercy whom He wills. And Allah is the possessor of great bounty.

clauses-english.clause: He selects for His mercy whom He wills.
And God is the possessor of great bounty.

368.verse-arabic: ۞ وَمِنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ مَنْ إِن تَأْمَنْهُ بِقِنطَارٍ يُؤَدِّهِ إِلَيْكَ وَمِنْهُم مَّنْ إِن تَأْمَنْهُ بِدِينَارٍ لَّا يُؤَدِّهِ إِلَيْكَ إِلَّا مَا دُمْتَ عَلَيْهِ قَائِمًا ۗ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ قَالُوا لَيْسَ عَلَيْنَا فِي الْأُمِّيِّينَ سَبِيلٌ وَيَقُولُونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ الْكَذِبَ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
368.verse-english: And among the People of the Scripture is he who, if you entrust him with a great amount [of wealth], he will return it to you. And among them is he who, if you entrust him with a [single] silver coin, he will not return it to you unless you are constantly standing over him [demanding it]. That is because they say, "There is no blame upon us concerning the unlearned." And they speak untruth about Allah while they know [it].

clauses-english.clause: And among the People of the Scripture is he who,
if you entrust him with a great amount [of wealth],
he will return it to you.
And among them is he who,
if you entrust him with a [single] silver coin,
he will not return it to you unless you are constantly standing over him [demanding it].
That is because they say,
"There is no blame upon us concerning the unlearned.
" And they speak untruth about God while they know [it].

369.verse-arabic: بَلَىٰ مَنْ أَوْفَىٰ بِعَهْدِهِ وَاتَّقَىٰ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ الْمُتَّقِينَ
369.verse-english: But yes, whoever fulfills his commitment and fears Allah - then indeed, Allah loves those who fear Him.

clauses-english.clause: But yes,
whoever fulfills his commitment and fears God -
then indeed,
God loves those who fear Him.

370.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَشْتَرُونَ بِعَهْدِ اللَّهِ وَأَيْمَانِهِمْ ثَمَنًا قَلِيلًا أُولَٰئِكَ لَا خَلَاقَ لَهُمْ فِي الْآخِرَةِ وَلَا يُكَلِّمُهُمُ اللَّهُ وَلَا يَنظُرُ إِلَيْهِمْ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَلَا يُزَكِّيهِمْ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
370.verse-english: Indeed, those who exchange the covenant of Allah and their [own] oaths for a small price will have no share in the Hereafter, and Allah will not speak to them or look at them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them; and they will have a painful punishment.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
those who exchange the covenant of God and their [own] oaths for a small price will have no share in the Hereafter,
and God will not speak to them or look at them on the Day of Resurrection,
nor will He purify them;
and they will have a painful punishment.

371.verse-arabic: وَإِنَّ مِنْهُمْ لَفَرِيقًا يَلْوُونَ أَلْسِنَتَهُم بِالْكِتَابِ لِتَحْسَبُوهُ مِنَ الْكِتَابِ وَمَا هُوَ مِنَ الْكِتَابِ وَيَقُولُونَ هُوَ مِنْ عِندِ اللَّهِ وَمَا هُوَ مِنْ عِندِ اللَّهِ وَيَقُولُونَ عَلَى اللَّهِ الْكَذِبَ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
371.verse-english: And indeed, there is among them a party who alter the Scripture with their tongues so you may think it is from the Scripture, but it is not from the Scripture. And they say, "This is from Allah," but it is not from Allah. And they speak untruth about Allah while they know.

clauses-english.clause: And indeed,
there is among them a party who alter the Scripture with their tongues so you may think it is from the Scripture,
but it is not from the Scripture.
And they say,
"This is from God,
" but it is not from God.
And they speak untruth about God while they know.

372.verse-arabic: مَا كَانَ لِبَشَرٍ أَن يُؤْتِيَهُ اللَّهُ الْكِتَابَ وَالْحُكْمَ وَالنُّبُوَّةَ ثُمَّ يَقُولَ لِلنَّاسِ كُونُوا عِبَادًا لِّي مِن دُونِ اللَّهِ وَلَٰكِن كُونُوا رَبَّانِيِّينَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تُعَلِّمُونَ الْكِتَابَ وَبِمَا كُنتُمْ تَدْرُسُونَ
372.verse-english: It is not for a human [prophet] that Allah should give him the Scripture and authority and prophethood and then he would say to the people, "Be servants to me rather than Allah," but [instead, he would say], "Be pious scholars of the Lord because of what you have taught of the Scripture and because of what you have studied."

clauses-english.clause: It is not for a human [prophet] that God should give him the Scripture and authority and prophethood and then he would say to the people,
"Be servants to me rather than God,
" but [instead,
he would say],
"Be pious scholars of the Lord because of what you have taught of the Scripture and because of what you have studied.

373.verse-arabic: وَلَا يَأْمُرَكُمْ أَن تَتَّخِذُوا الْمَلَائِكَةَ وَالنَّبِيِّينَ أَرْبَابًا ۗ أَيَأْمُرُكُم بِالْكُفْرِ بَعْدَ إِذْ أَنتُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
373.verse-english: Nor could he order you to take the angels and prophets as lords. Would he order you to disbelief after you had been Muslims?

clauses-english.clause: Nor could he order you to take the angels and prophets as lords.
Would he order you to disbelief after you had been Muslims?

374.verse-arabic: وَإِذْ أَخَذَ اللَّهُ مِيثَاقَ النَّبِيِّينَ لَمَا آتَيْتُكُم مِّن كِتَابٍ وَحِكْمَةٍ ثُمَّ جَاءَكُمْ رَسُولٌ مُّصَدِّقٌ لِّمَا مَعَكُمْ لَتُؤْمِنُنَّ بِهِ وَلَتَنصُرُنَّهُ ۚ قَالَ أَأَقْرَرْتُمْ وَأَخَذْتُمْ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكُمْ إِصْرِي ۖ قَالُوا أَقْرَرْنَا ۚ قَالَ فَاشْهَدُوا وَأَنَا مَعَكُم مِّنَ الشَّاهِدِينَ
374.verse-english: And [recall, O People of the Scripture], when Allah took the covenant of the prophets, [saying], "Whatever I give you of the Scripture and wisdom and then there comes to you a messenger confirming what is with you, you [must] believe in him and support him." [Allah] said, "Have you acknowledged and taken upon that My commitment?" They said, "We have acknowledged it." He said, "Then bear witness, and I am with you among the witnesses."

clauses-english.clause: And [recall,
O People of the Scripture],
when God took the covenant of the prophets,
[saying],
"Whatever I give you of the Scripture and wisdom and then there comes to you a messenger confirming what is with you,
you [must] believe in him and support him.
" [God] said,
"Have you acknowledged and taken upon that My commitment?
" They said,
"We have acknowledged it.
" He said,
"Then bear witness,
and I am with you among the witnesses.

375.verse-arabic: فَمَن تَوَلَّىٰ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْفَاسِقُونَ
375.verse-english: And whoever turned away after that - they were the defiantly disobedient.

clauses-english.clause: And whoever turned away after that -
they were the defiantly disobedient.

376.verse-arabic: أَفَغَيْرَ دِينِ اللَّهِ يَبْغُونَ وَلَهُ أَسْلَمَ مَن فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ طَوْعًا وَكَرْهًا وَإِلَيْهِ يُرْجَعُونَ
376.verse-english: So is it other than the religion of Allah they desire, while to Him have submitted [all] those within the heavens and earth, willingly or by compulsion, and to Him they will be returned?

clauses-english.clause: So is it other than the religion of God they desire,
while to Him have submitted [all] those within the heavens and earth,
willingly or by compulsion,
and to Him they will be returned?

377.verse-arabic: قُلْ آمَنَّا بِاللَّهِ وَمَا أُنزِلَ عَلَيْنَا وَمَا أُنزِلَ عَلَىٰ إِبْرَاهِيمَ وَإِسْمَاعِيلَ وَإِسْحَاقَ وَيَعْقُوبَ وَالْأَسْبَاطِ وَمَا أُوتِيَ مُوسَىٰ وَعِيسَىٰ وَالنَّبِيُّونَ مِن رَّبِّهِمْ لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَيْنَ أَحَدٍ مِّنْهُمْ وَنَحْنُ لَهُ مُسْلِمُونَ
377.verse-english: Say, "We have believed in Allah and in what was revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Descendants, and in what was given to Moses and Jesus and to the prophets from their Lord. We make no distinction between any of them, and we are Muslims [submitting] to Him."

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"We have believed in God and in what was revealed to us and what was revealed to Abraham,
Ishmael,
Isaac,
Jacob,
and the Descendants,
and in what was given to Moses and Jesus and to the prophets from their Lord.
We make no distinction between any of them,
and we are Muslims [submitting] to Him.

378.verse-arabic: وَمَن يَبْتَغِ غَيْرَ الْإِسْلَامِ دِينًا فَلَن يُقْبَلَ مِنْهُ وَهُوَ فِي الْآخِرَةِ مِنَ الْخَاسِرِينَ
378.verse-english: And whoever desires other than Islam as religion - never will it be accepted from him, and he, in the Hereafter, will be among the losers.

clauses-english.clause: And whoever desires other than Islam as religion -
never will it be accepted from him,
and he,
in the Hereafter,
will be among the losers.

379.verse-arabic: كَيْفَ يَهْدِي اللَّهُ قَوْمًا كَفَرُوا بَعْدَ إِيمَانِهِمْ وَشَهِدُوا أَنَّ الرَّسُولَ حَقٌّ وَجَاءَهُمُ الْبَيِّنَاتُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ لَا يَهْدِي الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ
379.verse-english: How shall Allah guide a people who disbelieved after their belief and had witnessed that the Messenger is true and clear signs had come to them? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

clauses-english.clause: How shall God guide a people who disbelieved after their belief and had witnessed that the Messenger is true and clear signs had come to them?
And God does not guide the wrongdoing people.

380.verse-arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ جَزَاؤُهُمْ أَنَّ عَلَيْهِمْ لَعْنَةَ اللَّهِ وَالْمَلَائِكَةِ وَالنَّاسِ أَجْمَعِينَ
380.verse-english: Those - their recompense will be that upon them is the curse of Allah and the angels and the people, all together,

clauses-english.clause: Those -
their recompense will be that upon them is the curse of God and the angels and the people,
all together,

381.verse-arabic: خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا لَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنْهُمُ الْعَذَابُ وَلَا هُمْ يُنظَرُونَ
381.verse-english: Abiding eternally therein. The punishment will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.

clauses-english.clause: Abiding eternally therein.
The punishment will not be lightened for them,
nor will they be reprieved.

382.verse-arabic: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ تَابُوا مِن بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ وَأَصْلَحُوا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
382.verse-english: Except for those who repent after that and correct themselves. For indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: Except for those who repent after that and correct themselves.
For indeed,
God is Forgiving and Merciful.

383.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا بَعْدَ إِيمَانِهِمْ ثُمَّ ازْدَادُوا كُفْرًا لَّن تُقْبَلَ تَوْبَتُهُمْ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الضَّالُّونَ
383.verse-english: Indeed, those who reject the message after their belief and then increase in disbelief - never will their [claimed] repentance be accepted, and they are the ones astray.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
those who reject the message after their belief and then increase in disbelief -
never will their [claimed] repentance be accepted,
and they are the ones astray.

384.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا وَمَاتُوا وَهُمْ كُفَّارٌ فَلَن يُقْبَلَ مِنْ أَحَدِهِم مِّلْءُ الْأَرْضِ ذَهَبًا وَلَوِ افْتَدَىٰ بِهِ ۗ أُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ وَمَا لَهُم مِّن نَّاصِرِينَ
384.verse-english: Indeed, those who disbelieve and die while they are disbelievers - never would the [whole] capacity of the earth in gold be accepted from one of them if he would [seek to] ransom himself with it. For those there will be a painful punishment, and they will have no helpers.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
those who disbelieve and die while they are disbelievers -
never would the [whole] capacity of the earth in gold be accepted from one of them if he would [seek to] ransom himself with it.
For those there will be a painful punishment,
and they will have no helpers.

385.verse-arabic: لَن تَنَالُوا الْبِرَّ حَتَّىٰ تُنفِقُوا مِمَّا تُحِبُّونَ ۚ وَمَا تُنفِقُوا مِن شَيْءٍ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ بِهِ عَلِيمٌ
385.verse-english: Never will you attain the good [reward] until you spend [in the way of Allah] from that which you love. And whatever you spend - indeed, Allah is Knowing of it.

clauses-english.clause: Never will you attain the good [reward] until you spend [in the way of God] from that which you love.
And whatever you spend -
indeed,
God is Knowing of it.

386.verse-arabic: ۞ كُلُّ الطَّعَامِ كَانَ حِلًّا لِّبَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ إِلَّا مَا حَرَّمَ إِسْرَائِيلُ عَلَىٰ نَفْسِهِ مِن قَبْلِ أَن تُنَزَّلَ التَّوْرَاةُ ۗ قُلْ فَأْتُوا بِالتَّوْرَاةِ فَاتْلُوهَا إِن كُنتُمْ صَادِقِينَ
386.verse-english: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel except what Israel had made unlawful to himself before the Torah was revealed. Say, [O Muhammad], "So bring the Torah and recite it, if you should be truthful."

clauses-english.clause: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel except what Israel had made unlawful to himself before the Torah was revealed.
Say,
[O Muhammad],
"So bring the Torah and recite it,
if you should be truthful.

387.verse-arabic: فَمَنِ افْتَرَىٰ عَلَى اللَّهِ الْكَذِبَ مِن بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ
387.verse-english: And whoever invents about Allah untruth after that - then those are [truly] the wrongdoers.

clauses-english.clause: And whoever invents about God untruth after that -
then those are [truly] the wrongdoers.

388.verse-arabic: قُلْ صَدَقَ اللَّهُ ۗ فَاتَّبِعُوا مِلَّةَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ حَنِيفًا وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ الْمُشْرِكِينَ
388.verse-english: Say, "Allah has told the truth. So follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of the polytheists."

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"God has told the truth.
So follow the religion of Abraham,
inclining toward truth;
and he was not of the polytheists.

389.verse-arabic: إِنَّ أَوَّلَ بَيْتٍ وُضِعَ لِلنَّاسِ لَلَّذِي بِبَكَّةَ مُبَارَكًا وَهُدًى لِّلْعَالَمِينَ
389.verse-english: Indeed, the first House [of worship] established for mankind was that at Makkah - blessed and a guidance for the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
the first House [of worship] established for mankind was that at Makkah -
blessed and a guidance for the worlds.

390.verse-arabic: فِيهِ آيَاتٌ بَيِّنَاتٌ مَّقَامُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ ۖ وَمَن دَخَلَهُ كَانَ آمِنًا ۗ وَلِلَّهِ عَلَى النَّاسِ حِجُّ الْبَيْتِ مَنِ اسْتَطَاعَ إِلَيْهِ سَبِيلًا ۚ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَنِيٌّ عَنِ الْعَالَمِينَ
390.verse-english: In it are clear signs [such as] the standing place of Abraham. And whoever enters it shall be safe. And [due] to Allah from the people is a pilgrimage to the House - for whoever is able to find thereto a way. But whoever disbelieves - then indeed, Allah is free from need of the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: In it are clear signs [such as] the standing place of Abraham.
And whoever enters it shall be safe.
And [due] to God from the people is a pilgrimage to the House -
for whoever is able to find thereto a way.
But whoever disbelieves -
then indeed,
God is free from need of the worlds.

391.verse-arabic: قُلْ يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ لِمَ تَكْفُرُونَ بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ وَاللَّهُ شَهِيدٌ عَلَىٰ مَا تَعْمَلُونَ
391.verse-english: Say, "O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in the verses of Allah while Allah is Witness over what you do?"

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"O People of the Scripture,
why do you disbelieve in the verses of God while God is Witness over what you do?

392.verse-arabic: قُلْ يَا أَهْلَ الْكِتَابِ لِمَ تَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ مَنْ آمَنَ تَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًا وَأَنتُمْ شُهَدَاءُ ۗ وَمَا اللَّهُ بِغَافِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
392.verse-english: Say, "O People of the Scripture, why do you avert from the way of Allah those who believe, seeking to make it [seem] deviant, while you are witnesses [to the truth]? And Allah is not unaware of what you do."

clauses-english.clause: Say,
"O People of the Scripture,
why do you avert from the way of God those who believe,
seeking to make it [seem] deviant,
while you are witnesses [to the truth]?
And God is not unaware of what you do.

393.verse-arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا إِن تُطِيعُوا فَرِيقًا مِّنَ الَّذِينَ أُوتُوا الْكِتَابَ يَرُدُّوكُم بَعْدَ إِيمَانِكُمْ كَافِرِينَ
393.verse-english: O you who have believed, if you obey a party of those who were given the Scripture, they would turn you back, after your belief, [to being] unbelievers.

clauses-english.clause: O you who have believed,
if you obey a party of those who were given the Scripture,
they would turn you back,
after your belief,
[to being] unbelievers.

394.verse-arabic: وَكَيْفَ تَكْفُرُونَ وَأَنتُمْ تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْكُمْ آيَاتُ اللَّهِ وَفِيكُمْ رَسُولُهُ ۗ وَمَن يَعْتَصِم بِاللَّهِ فَقَدْ هُدِيَ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ
394.verse-english: And how could you disbelieve while to you are being recited the verses of Allah and among you is His Messenger? And whoever holds firmly to Allah has [indeed] been guided to a straight path.

clauses-english.clause: And how could you disbelieve while to you are being recited the verses of God and among you is His Messenger?
And whoever holds firmly to God has [indeed] been guided to a straight path.

395.verse-arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا اتَّقُوا اللَّهَ حَقَّ تُقَاتِهِ وَلَا تَمُوتُنَّ إِلَّا وَأَنتُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
395.verse-english: O you who have believed, fear Allah as He should be feared and do not die except as Muslims [in submission to Him].

clauses-english.clause: O you who have believed,
fear God as He should be feared and do not die except as Muslims [in submission to Him].

396.verse-arabic: وَاعْتَصِمُوا بِحَبْلِ اللَّهِ جَمِيعًا وَلَا تَفَرَّقُوا ۚ وَاذْكُرُوا نِعْمَتَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ إِذْ كُنتُمْ أَعْدَاءً فَأَلَّفَ بَيْنَ قُلُوبِكُمْ فَأَصْبَحْتُم بِنِعْمَتِهِ إِخْوَانًا وَكُنتُمْ عَلَىٰ شَفَا حُفْرَةٍ مِّنَ النَّارِ فَأَنقَذَكُم مِّنْهَا ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ آيَاتِهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
396.verse-english: And hold firmly to the rope of Allah all together and do not become divided. And remember the favor of Allah upon you - when you were enemies and He brought your hearts together and you became, by His favor, brothers. And you were on the edge of a pit of the Fire, and He saved you from it. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses that you may be guided.

clauses-english.clause: And hold firmly to the rope of God all together and do not become divided.
And remember the favor of God upon you -
when you were enemies and He brought your hearts together and you became,
by His favor,
brothers.
And you were on the edge of a pit of the Fire,
and He saved you from it.
Thus does God make clear to you His verses that you may be guided.

397.verse-arabic: وَلْتَكُن مِّنكُمْ أُمَّةٌ يَدْعُونَ إِلَى الْخَيْرِ وَيَأْمُرُونَ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ الْمُنكَرِ ۚ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
397.verse-english: And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good, enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong, and those will be the successful.

clauses-english.clause: And let there be [arising] from you a nation inviting to [all that is] good,
enjoining what is right and forbidding what is wrong,
and those will be the successful.

398.verse-arabic: وَلَا تَكُونُوا كَالَّذِينَ تَفَرَّقُوا وَاخْتَلَفُوا مِن بَعْدِ مَا جَاءَهُمُ الْبَيِّنَاتُ ۚ وَأُولَٰئِكَ لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
398.verse-english: And do not be like the ones who became divided and differed after the clear proofs had come to them. And those will have a great punishment.

clauses-english.clause: And do not be like the ones who became divided and differed after the clear proofs had come to them.
And those will have a great punishment.

399.verse-arabic: يَوْمَ تَبْيَضُّ وُجُوهٌ وَتَسْوَدُّ وُجُوهٌ ۚ فَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ اسْوَدَّتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ أَكَفَرْتُم بَعْدَ إِيمَانِكُمْ فَذُوقُوا الْعَذَابَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْفُرُونَ
399.verse-english: On the Day [some] faces will turn white and [some] faces will turn black. As for those whose faces turn black, [to them it will be said], "Did you disbelieve after your belief? Then taste the punishment for what you used to reject."

clauses-english.clause: On the Day [some] faces will turn white and [some] faces will turn black.
As for those whose faces turn black,
[to them it will be said],
"Did you disbelieve after your belief?
Then taste the punishment for what you used to reject.

400.verse-arabic: وَأَمَّا الَّذِينَ ابْيَضَّتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ فَفِي رَحْمَةِ اللَّهِ هُمْ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ
400.verse-english: But as for those whose faces will turn white, [they will be] within the mercy of Allah. They will abide therein eternally.

clauses-english.clause: But as for those whose faces will turn white,
[they will be] within the mercy of God.
They will abide therein eternally.

401.verse-arabic: تِلْكَ آيَاتُ اللَّهِ نَتْلُوهَا عَلَيْكَ بِالْحَقِّ ۗ وَمَا اللَّهُ يُرِيدُ ظُلْمًا لِّلْعَالَمِينَ
401.verse-english: These are the verses of Allah. We recite them to you, [O Muhammad], in truth; and Allah wants no injustice to the worlds.

clauses-english.clause: These are the verses of God.
We recite them to you,
[O Muhammad],
in truth;
and God wants no injustice to the worlds.

402.verse-arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ تُرْجَعُ الْأُمُورُ
402.verse-english: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And to Allah will [all] matters be returned.

clauses-english.clause: To God belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth.
And to God will [all] matters be returned.

403.verse-arabic: كُنتُمْ خَيْرَ أُمَّةٍ أُخْرِجَتْ لِلنَّاسِ تَأْمُرُونَ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَتَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ الْمُنكَرِ وَتُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ ۗ وَلَوْ آمَنَ أَهْلُ الْكِتَابِ لَكَانَ خَيْرًا لَّهُم ۚ مِّنْهُمُ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ وَأَكْثَرُهُمُ الْفَاسِقُونَ
403.verse-english: You are the best nation produced [as an example] for mankind. You enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and believe in Allah. If only the People of the Scripture had believed, it would have been better for them. Among them are believers, but most of them are defiantly disobedient.

clauses-english.clause: You are the best nation produced [as an example] for mankind.
You enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and believe in God.
If only the People of the Scripture had believed,
it would have been better for them.
Among them are believers,
but most of them are defiantly disobedient.

404.verse-arabic: لَن يَضُرُّوكُمْ إِلَّا أَذًى ۖ وَإِن يُقَاتِلُوكُمْ يُوَلُّوكُمُ الْأَدْبَارَ ثُمَّ لَا يُنصَرُونَ
404.verse-english: They will not harm you except for [some] annoyance. And if they fight you, they will show you their backs; then they will not be aided.

clauses-english.clause: They will not harm you except for [some] annoyance.
And if they fight you,
they will show you their backs;
then they will not be aided.

405.verse-arabic: ضُرِبَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ الذِّلَّةُ أَيْنَ مَا ثُقِفُوا إِلَّا بِحَبْلٍ مِّنَ اللَّهِ وَحَبْلٍ مِّنَ النَّاسِ وَبَاءُوا بِغَضَبٍ مِّنَ اللَّهِ وَضُرِبَتْ عَلَيْهِمُ الْمَسْكَنَةُ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا يَكْفُرُونَ بِآيَاتِ اللَّهِ وَيَقْتُلُونَ الْأَنبِيَاءَ بِغَيْرِ حَقٍّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِمَا عَصَوا وَّكَانُوا يَعْتَدُونَ
405.verse-english: They have been put under humiliation [by Allah] wherever they are overtaken, except for a covenant from Allah and a rope from the Muslims. And they have drawn upon themselves anger from Allah and have been put under destitution. That is because they disbelieved in the verses of Allah and killed the prophets without right. That is because they disobeyed and [habitually] transgressed.

clauses-english.clause: They have been put under humiliation [by God] wherever they are overtaken,
except for a covenant from God and a rope from the Muslims.
And they have drawn upon themselves anger from God and have been put under destitution.
That is because they disbelieved in the verses of God and killed the prophets without right.
That is because they disobeyed and [habitually] transgressed.

406.verse-arabic: ۞ لَيْسُوا سَوَاءً ۗ مِّنْ أَهْلِ الْكِتَابِ أُمَّةٌ قَائِمَةٌ يَتْلُونَ آيَاتِ اللَّهِ آنَاءَ اللَّيْلِ وَهُمْ يَسْجُدُونَ
406.verse-english: They are not [all] the same; among the People of the Scripture is a community standing [in obedience], reciting the verses of Allah during periods of the night and prostrating [in prayer].

clauses-english.clause: They are not [all] the same;
among the People of the Scripture is a community standing [in obedience],
reciting the verses of God during periods of the night and prostrating [in prayer].

407.verse-arabic: يُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ وَيَأْمُرُونَ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ الْمُنكَرِ وَيُسَارِعُونَ فِي الْخَيْرَاتِ وَأُولَٰئِكَ مِنَ الصَّالِحِينَ
407.verse-english: They believe in Allah and the Last Day, and they enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and hasten to good deeds. And those are among the righteous.

clauses-english.clause: They believe in God and the Last Day,
and they enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong and hasten to good deeds.
And those are among the righteous.

408.verse-arabic: وَمَا يَفْعَلُوا مِنْ خَيْرٍ فَلَن يُكْفَرُوهُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِالْمُتَّقِينَ
408.verse-english: And whatever good they do - never will it be removed from them. And Allah is Knowing of the righteous.

clauses-english.clause: And whatever good they do -
never will it be removed from them.
And God is Knowing of the righteous.

409.verse-arabic: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَن تُغْنِيَ عَنْهُمْ أَمْوَالُهُمْ وَلَا أَوْلَادُهُم مِّنَ اللَّهِ شَيْئًا ۖ وَأُولَٰئِكَ أَصْحَابُ النَّارِ ۚ هُمْ فِيهَا خَالِدُونَ
409.verse-english: Indeed, those who disbelieve - never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allah at all, and those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.

clauses-english.clause: Indeed,
those who disbelieve -
never will their wealth or their children avail them against God at all,
and those are the companions of the Fire;
they will abide therein eternally.

410.verse-arabic: مَثَلُ مَا يُنفِقُونَ فِي هَٰذِهِ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا كَمَثَلِ رِيحٍ فِيهَا صِرٌّ أَصَابَتْ حَرْثَ قَوْمٍ ظَلَمُوا أَنفُسَهُمْ فَأَهْلَكَتْهُ ۚ وَمَا ظَلَمَهُمُ اللَّهُ وَلَٰكِنْ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
410.verse-english: The example of what they spend in this worldly life is like that of a wind containing frost which strikes the harvest of a people who have wronged themselves and destroys it. And Allah has not wronged them, but they wrong themselves.

clauses-english.clause: The example of what they spend in this worldly life is like that of a wind containing frost which strikes the harvest of a people who have wronged themselves and destroys it.
And God has not wronged them,
but they wrong themselves.

411.verse-arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَتَّخِذُوا بِطَانَةً مِّن دُونِكُمْ لَا يَأْلُونَكُمْ خَبَالًا وَدُّوا مَا عَنِتُّمْ قَدْ بَدَتِ الْبَغْضَاءُ مِنْ أَفْوَاهِهِمْ وَمَا تُخْفِي صُدُورُهُمْ أَكْبَرُ ۚ قَدْ بَيَّنَّا لَكُمُ الْآيَاتِ ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
411.verse-english: O you who have believed, do not take as intimates those other than yourselves, for they will not spare you [any] ruin. They wish you would have hardship. Hatred has already appeared from their mouths, and what their breasts conceal is greater. We have certainly made clear to you the signs, if you will use reason.

clauses-english.clause: O you who have believed,
do not take as intimates those other than yourselves,
for they will not spare you [any] ruin.
They wish you would have hardship.
Hatred has already appeared from their mouths,
and what their breasts conceal is greater.
We have certainly made clear to you the signs,
if you will use reason.

412.verse-arabic: هَا أَنتُمْ أُولَاءِ تُحِبُّونَهُمْ وَلَا يُحِبُّونَكُمْ وَتُؤْمِنُونَ بِالْكِتَابِ كُلِّهِ وَإِذَا لَقُوكُمْ قَالُوا آمَنَّا وَإِذَا خَلَوْا عَضُّوا عَلَيْكُمُ الْأَنَامِلَ مِنَ الْغَيْظِ ۚ قُلْ مُوتُوا بِغَيْظِكُمْ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ بِذَاتِ الصُّدُورِ
412.verse-english: Here you are loving them but they are not loving you, while you believe in the Scripture - all of it. And when they meet you, they say, "We believe." But when they are alone, they bite their fingertips at you in rage. Say, "Die in your rage. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts."

clauses-english.clause: Here you are loving them but they are not loving you,
while you believe in the Scripture -
all of it.
And when they meet you,
they say,
"We believe.
" But when they are alone,
they bite their fingertips at you in rage.
Say,
"Die in your rage.
Indeed,
God is Knowing of that within the breasts.

413.verse-arabic: إِن تَمْسَسْكُمْ حَسَنَةٌ تَسُؤْهُمْ وَإِن تُصِبْكُمْ سَيِّئَةٌ يَفْرَحُوا بِهَا ۖ وَإِن تَصْبِرُوا وَتَتَّقُوا لَا يَضُرُّكُمْ كَيْدُهُمْ شَيْئًا ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ بِمَا يَعْمَلُونَ مُحِيطٌ
413.verse-english: If good touches you, it distresses them; but if harm strikes you, they rejoice at it. And if you are patient and fear Allah, their plot will not harm you at all. Indeed, Allah is encompassing of what they do.

clauses-english.clause: If good touches you,
it distresses them;
but if harm strikes you,
they rejoice at it.
And if you are patient and fear God,
their plot will not harm you at all.
Indeed,
God is encompassing of what they do.

414.verse-arabic: وَإِذْ غَدَوْتَ مِنْ أَهْلِكَ تُبَوِّئُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ مَقَاعِدَ لِلْقِتَالِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
414.verse-english: And [remember] when you, [O Muhammad], left your family in the morning to post the believers at their stations for the battle [of Uhud] - and Allah is Hearing and Knowing -

clauses-english.clause: And [remember] when you,
[O Muhammad],
left your family in the morning to post the believers at their stations for the battle [of Uhud] -
and God is Hearing and Knowing -

415.verse-arabic: إِذْ هَمَّت طَّائِفَتَانِ مِنكُمْ أَن تَفْشَلَا وَاللَّهُ وَلِيُّهُمَا ۗ وَعَلَى اللَّهِ فَلْيَتَوَكَّلِ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ
415.verse-english: When two parties among you were about to lose courage, but Allah was their ally; and upon Allah the believers should rely.

clauses-english.clause: When two parties among you were about to lose courage,
but God was their ally;
and upon God the believers should rely.

416.verse-arabic: وَلَقَدْ نَصَرَكُمُ اللَّهُ بِبَدْرٍ وَأَنتُمْ أَذِلَّةٌ ۖ فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَشْكُرُونَ
416.verse-english: And already had Allah given you victory at [the battle of] Badr while you were few in number. Then fear Allah; perhaps you will be grateful.

clauses-english.clause: And already had God given you victory at [the battle of] Badr while you were few in number.
Then fear God;
perhaps you will be grateful.

417.verse-arabic: إِذْ تَقُولُ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ أَلَن يَكْفِيَكُمْ أَن يُمِدَّكُمْ رَبُّكُم بِثَلَاثَةِ آلَافٍ مِّنَ الْمَلَائِكَةِ مُنزَلِينَ
417.verse-english: [Remember] when you said to the believers, "Is it not sufficient for you that your Lord should reinforce you with three thousand angels sent down?

clauses-english.clause: [Remember] when you said to the believers,
"Is it not sufficient for you that your Lord should reinforce you with three thousand angels sent down?

418.verse-arabic: بَلَىٰ ۚ إِن تَصْبِرُوا وَتَتَّقُوا وَيَأْتُوكُم مِّن فَوْرِهِمْ هَٰذَا يُمْدِدْكُمْ رَبُّكُم بِخَمْسَةِ آلَافٍ مِّنَ الْمَلَائِكَةِ مُسَوِّمِينَ
418.verse-english: Yes, if you remain patient and conscious of Allah and the enemy come upon you [attacking] in rage, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels having marks [of distinction]

clauses-english.clause: Yes,
if you remain patient and conscious of God and the enemy come upon you [attacking] in rage,
your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels having marks [of distinction]

419.verse-arabic: وَمَا جَعَلَهُ اللَّهُ إِلَّا بُشْرَىٰ لَكُمْ وَلِتَطْمَئِنَّ قُلُوبُكُم بِهِ ۗ وَمَا النَّصْرُ إِلَّا مِنْ عِندِ اللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْحَكِيمِ
419.verse-english: And Allah made it not except as [a sign of] good tidings for you and to reassure your hearts thereby. And victory is not except from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise -

clauses-english.clause: And God made it not except as [a sign of] good tidings for you and to reassure your hearts thereby.
And victory is not except from God,
the Exalted in Might,
the Wise -

420.verse-arabic: لِيَقْطَعَ طَرَفًا مِّنَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَوْ يَكْبِتَهُمْ فَيَنقَلِبُوا خَائِبِينَ
420.verse-english: That He might cut down a section of the disbelievers or suppress them so that they turn back disappointed.

clauses-arabic.clause: لِيَقْطَعَ طَرَفًا مِّنَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَوْ يَكْبِتَهُمْ فَيَنقَلِبُوا خَائِبِينَ

clauses-english.clause: That He might cut down a section of the disbelievers or suppress them so that they turn back disappointed.

421.verse-arabic: لَيْسَ لَكَ مِنَ الْأَمْرِ شَيْءٌ أَوْ يَتُوبَ عَلَيْهِمْ أَوْ يُعَذِّبَهُمْ فَإِنَّهُمْ ظَالِمُونَ
421.verse-english: Not for you, [O Muhammad, but for Allah], is the decision whether He should [cut them down] or forgive them or punish them, for indeed, they are wrongdoers.

clauses-english.clause: Not for you,
[O Muhammad,
but for God],
is the decision whether He should [cut them down] or forgive them or punish them,
for indeed,
they are wrongdoers.

422.verse-arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ يَغْفِرُ لِمَن يَشَاءُ وَيُعَذِّبُ مَن يَشَاءُ ۚ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
422.verse-english: And to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

clauses-english.clause: And to God belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth.
He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills.
And God is Forgiving and Merciful.

423.verse-arabic: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَأْكُلُوا الرِّبَا أَضْعَافًا مُّضَاعَفَةً ۖ وَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
423.verse-english: O you who have believed, do not consume usury, doubled and multiplied, but fear Allah that you may be successful.

clauses-english.clause: O you who have believed,
do not consume usury,
doubled and multiplied,
but fear God that you may be successful.

424.verse-english: And fear the Fire, which has been prepared for the disbelievers.

clauses-english.clause: And fear the Fire,
which has been prepared for the disbelievers.

425.verse-english: And obey Allah and the Messenger that you may obtain mercy.

clauses-english.clause: And obey God and the Messenger that you may obtain mercy.

426.verse-arabic: ۞ وَسَارِعُوا إِلَىٰ مَغْفِرَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَجَنَّةٍ عَرْضُهَا السَّمَاوَاتُ وَالْأَرْضُ أُعِدَّتْ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
426.verse-english: And hasten to forgiveness from your Lord and a garden as wide as the heavens and earth, prepared for the righteous

clauses-english.clause: And hasten to forgiveness from your Lord and a garden as wide as the heavens and earth,
prepared for the righteous

427.verse-arabic: الَّذِينَ يُنفِقُونَ فِي السَّرَّاءِ وَالضَّرَّاءِ وَالْكَاظِمِينَ الْغَيْظَ وَالْعَافِينَ عَنِ النَّاسِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يُحِبُّ الْمُحْسِنِينَ
427.verse-english: Who spend [in the cause of Allah] during ease and hardship and who restrain anger and who pardon the people - and Allah loves the doers of good;

clauses-english.clause: Who spend [in the cause of God] during ease and hardship and who restrain anger and who pardon the people -
and God loves the doers of good;

428.verse-arabic: وَالَّذِينَ إِذَا فَعَلُوا فَاحِشَةً أَوْ ظَلَمُوا أَنفُسَهُمْ ذَكَرُوا اللَّهَ فَاسْتَغْفَرُوا لِذُنُوبِهِمْ وَمَن يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَلَمْ يُصِرُّوا عَلَىٰ مَا فَعَلُوا وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ
428.verse-english: And those who, when they commit an immorality or wrong themselves [by transgression], remember Allah and seek forgiveness for their sins - and who can forgive sins except Allah? - and [who] do not persist in what they have done while they know.

clauses-english.clause: And those who,
when they commit an immorality or wrong themselves [by transgression],
remember God and seek forgiveness for their sins -
and who can forgive sins except God?
and [who] do not persist in what they have done while they know.

429.verse-arabic: أُولَٰئِكَ جَزَاؤُهُم مَّغْفِرَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ وَجَنَّاتٌ تَجْرِي مِن تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ وَنِعْمَ أَجْرُ الْعَامِلِينَ
429.verse-english: Those - their reward is forgiveness from their Lord and gardens beneath which rivers flow [in Paradise], wherein they will abide eternally; and excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers.

clauses-english.clause: Those -
their reward is forgiveness from their Lord and gardens beneath which rivers flow [in Paradise],
wherein they will abide eternally;
and excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers.

430.verse-arabic: قَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِكُمْ سُنَنٌ فَسِيرُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ فَانظُرُوا كَيْفَ كَانَ عَاقِبَةُ الْمُكَذِّبِينَ
430.verse-english: Similar situations [as yours] have passed on before you, so proceed throughout the earth and observe how was the end of those who denied.

clauses-english.clause: Similar situations [as yours] have passed on before you,
so proceed throughout the earth and observe how was the end of those who denied.

431.verse-arabic: هَٰذَا بَيَانٌ لِّلنَّاسِ وَهُدًى وَمَوْعِظَةٌ لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ
431.verse-english: This [Qur'an] is a clear statement to [all] the people and a guidance and instruction for those conscious of Allah.

clauses-arabic.clause: هَٰذَا بَيَانٌ لِّلنَّاسِ وَهُدًى وَمَوْعِظَةٌ لِّلْمُتَّقِينَ

clauses-english.clause: This [Qur'an] is a clear statement to [all] the people and a guidance and instruction for those conscious of God.

432.verse-arabic: وَلَا تَهِنُوا وَلَا تَحْزَنُوا وَأَنتُمُ الْأَعْلَوْنَ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
432.verse-english: So do not weaken and do not grieve, and you will be superior if you are [true] believers.

clauses-english.clause: So do not weaken and do not grieve,
